document.full_text: the alabama department of public health said that a contaminated intravenous nutritional supplement that was given to nine patients who died was due to a bacterial contamination in a water faucet.
document.title: south: alabama: bacteria found in pharmacy faucet
lines_and_colors: the alabama department of public health said that a contaminated intravenous nutritional supplement that was given to nine patients who died was due to a bacterial contamination in a water faucet.
